## Saratoga County History Center

21 Fairground Ave.  
Ballston Spa, NY 12020

**Winter Hours**

Saturdays – Sundays 12 – 4pm

Research Library By Appointment

_Please check our page on Facebook for the most up to date information about weather related closures.<https://www.facebook.com/brooksidemuseum>_

We are housed at 21 Fairground Ave. in historic Ballston Spa, NY. Originally built as a resort hotel in 1792, the museum’s history is as diverse as the people who visited here. The manse is among the oldest hotel buildings still standing in the United States and is on the National Register of Historic Places. At one time a boys’ school, the building has also been a private residence, a boarding house, a sanitarium, and apartments. In 1970, Saratoga County History Center purchased the building and opened it as a museum. SCHC offers the Capital Region exhibit galleries, a hands-on-history room, a conference space for businesses, a research library, and a local artisans gift shop.

* * *

## Gift Shop

The SCHC Gift shop is filled with items made by local artisans. Shop for unique gift items including: toys, jewelry, cards, home decor, mugs, CDs, original art work by local artists, books of local historical interest and more. You can now shop a selection of items on our** _[Online Shop](https://saratoga-county-historical-society-brookside-museum.square.site/)._ **

Receive SCHC’s newsletter, access to special events, free museum and library admission,  and reduced prices for events.

### Brookside Contributor: $100

All the above benefits plus: Welcome packet, membership card with [North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) membership](https://narmassociation.org/) and a 10% discount at the museum shop. Please note that family memberships are determined by each participating institution. While NARM does not have a standard area of restriction, some institutions do restrict benefits. # Saratoga County History Center

The Saratoga County History Center inspires community memory and tells the story of Saratoga County. SCHC is vital to the growth of our community because it unifies and strengthens communal bonds, fosters exploration and discovery about shared heritage, exercises imaginations, and provides inspiration for societal growth. SCHC promotes a deeper understanding, appreciation, and enjoyment of Saratoga County’s past for an audience of diverse backgrounds and levels of interest through interactive education programs, innovative exhibits, ambitious web programming, personal experiences, and enduring relationships.
